column13: Great Prime Rib and Steaks, with an outstanding salad bar.
A good choice for dinner before the theater/concert. Shuttle service especially appreciated.

Food was really good, three of us were very pleased. The only thing that could have made it better was if the escargot would have been a little tastier (they were a little bland) and the lamb chops had too much game taste. The crab cake, filet mignon and bread pudding were very good! I would go back.

This was our second time eating here. First time was excellent; we had sea bass special and wild boar pasta dishes. This time, the wild boar pasta dish was very different - more like pot roast with pasta. It was fine, just not special. Tiramisu was great.

column4: 21 Waterway Avenue Ste. 130 The Woodlands, TX  77380
column13: Had a great anniversary dinner, with the exception of one waiter (not ours) who kept interrupting our dinner and conversation. He not only annoyed us he kept touching my shoulder while speaking to us. This is not acceptable. Our "real" waiter was very good and attentive withoug being obtrusive. I would definately go back as the food was supbert and well presented, but would avoid "Mr. Feelgood".
My guests were from El Salvador and Columbia. New to Houston, they loved the place - talking to the staff about the various dishes featured on the brunch menu.

column4: 25250 Grogans Park Dr The Woodlands, TX  77380
column13: Since they have changed chef's the menu has become limited. Large fish selection but only 2 options each for chicken, steak and veal.
Really liked this restaurant. Great waiter and wonderful food in a nice, romantic setting.
This was my first visit here. The service was quite good abs the food was great. The portions are very reasonable and everything we tried was tasty.
Food was awesome and our waiter was terrific. Will definitely be back soon.

Food is excellent quality and quite tasty. Ordinarily I hate watching my meal being prepared, but the almost zen-like calm in the kitchen along with the shining stainless counters and big red pots are so elegant, it's pleasant background rather than a distraction. I love the fact that they have good choices for those who must choose gluten-free eating. It is pricey, but well worth it.

column4: 800 Bagby Street, Suite 400 Hobby Center of the Performing Arts Houston, TX  77002
column13: Restaurant, food and service were very good. Beautiful to sit outisde and have a drink. We went to a show at the Hibby Center and after the show wanted to get a drink......Only complaint I have is their bar shuts down at 10pm; it would have been nice to have a night cap sitting outside to finish off the evening.

The food was excellent, although there was one glitch - our food was delivered table-side and sat there for 5 minutes before it was placed in front of us. The staff apologized and certainly made up for the inconvenience by providing us with a glass of wine, gratis. We will definitely dine at Arturo's again!

My wife and I went to Aura to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We were blown away! We highly recommend the 5-course Chef Prepared tasting menu. The Chef appeared to have pulled from the specials menu but the selection of food choices were outstanding. The Chef picked almost every item I wanted to try off the special menu and they all fit together perfectly. The Grand Marnier souffle was probably the best dessert that my wife and I ever had. We will definitely be going back again soon (even if it is just for the souffle!)
Great experience. Fantastic food and service. Would recommend it.
We go there for the Crazy Irishmen roll. The best!!

Restaurant was responsive for a secluded table so I could host a business lunch. Waiter was very helpful not to interrupt our conversation and waiting for appropriate time to address the group. Was a perfect backdrop for a successful business meeting. Seating was a bit tight for our party of six. I would have preferred two or more tables put together as we seemed to be seated at a predefined large table. It was too tight.

The menu was limited due to remodeling of the kitchen but the food was good. The ambiance was great with dim lighting and outdoor seating. The only down side of the night was the night I went to dine was that their system crashed and they were unable to process any transactions. That's fine, these things happen. But rather than the waitress informing us of the situation, she never came to our table and we waited for over a hour to receive any food or drinks. I was hot in the area I was sitting in the fan was directly above my head so no air was coming toward us. It was just a mess, next time they should establish a manual procedure when their system goes down.

They must not have a full staff during the week or at least on Mondays, service was a little slow but the food was good and the deal they offer for your birthday is the best, $30 to use the month of your birthday.

Used Opentable to reserve a lunch date with my spouse (part of 2). Instead of getting the reservation for a table, the server said "no wait and you can sit now." Which meant instead of using your reservation, we will sit you with a group of 6 that have already ordered and are going to wait on you at the grill. No happy about that!

column4: 2579 Town Center Blvd N Sugar Land, TX  77479
column13: Great place to visit and fun during the food. The food is really good!
Had reservation for 7, got seated at 8.
Great food near Rice University

Benjy's is great to pop in for a quick and delicious lunch. The Cobb salad is to die for! The food is wonderful and the service is always great. The only downside was not getting a Wi Fi connection, but I did pay more attention to my food. This is a must do restaurant.

Make the drive from Houston. Tip-top brunch lineup. Well organized. Food dishes are varied and well prep'ed. Decent senior discounts. Better than Baba Yega but not the artistry of Hugo's brunches in Houston but with the Hotel Galvez and the Gulf as backdrops, very good rating cannot be denied.

It was a ladies night kind of dinner! The ambiance was set by the amazing live musician. The server was knowledable and gave us the drink feature and best items on the menu. We took his advice and we were very happy. From the moment we walked in to the valet at the end we had a great experience!
I haven't eaten there in many years and was surprised at how the food was so good. It was very crowded because it was a theatre night. The service was excellent. We will return for another meal.

New menu was ambitious and well executed. We bought a Groupon and unfortunately the kitchen got "slammed" just as we arrived. The service was therefore slow but by no means unacceptable. As a result of the large crowd we have a leisurely dinner and my ribeye was slightly overcooked. This was our second visit and we enjoyed the food both times. Note to other diners: Take advantage of the "free" valet parking and get your parking ticket validated. City Centre is notorious for the lack of parking spaces.

The food was excellent, from appetizer to dessert. The staff was very friendly and always had a smile. We ate on the patio, and there was an excellent two-man band playing songs and singing in French. A great experience.
Too crowded. Service not up to prices.
Good food (but not as great as a steakhouse). Good ambiance. There Houston Restaurant Weeks menu was 4 delicious courses!

We were there for 30 minutes and saw our waiter twice. There were 4 of us and we ordered 4 drinks, 3 of which were cocktails, one was a glass of wine. Our waiter brought one drink out because it was the only one that was ready (ironcially, a cocktail). We finally got the other 3 and the "snacks" we ordered as appetizers: truffled popcorn, cheesy potato bites and the rissoto balls. The popcorn was stale. It was around 9:00 on Friday night and when we voice concern about the stale popcorn we were assured it was fresh, made that day, at 4:00. It's popcorn, why can't it be made to order? 5 hour old popcorn that has been sitting out is not going to be fresh. The fried potato things were room temp. We walked out and went to Kata Robata instead.
This is our 2nd time at this restaurant in 30 days. Since moving to Houston, we cannot get enough of this spot. Great atmosphere, great food and great service.
Good sushi. Valet parking is $9 before tip. Very few diners - downtown location and quiet at night.
This place rocks !! my new favorite Sushi Restaurant . Amazing wine from Synopsis is a plus ....... Sushi Tower is awesome
Attended the Friday night seafood buffet. The food choices were excellent! A great place if you want to spend a quiet Friday evening with family.
Great food and a great whiskey menu. Waitress was attentive and pleasant. I felt the food menuwas somewhat restricted, however. Food served was excellent.
food not great- pricey food but very reasonable wine pricing. service was very good.

We were seated upstairs, which was nice, romantic and quiet. Our waiter was Jad, very charming fellow! We did a bloomspot 4 course tasting, and I must say, everything was perfect! I was so full, we had to take dessert home! The French onion soup was by far the best I've had!!!
It is like being teleported into the French Quarter

Quite honestly, it just wasn't as good as it used to be. We had a party of 8, the wine was perfect, the salads were great, but the entree's were lacking. We love the atmosphere, the staff, it's like our neighborhood go to spot. But we are a little dissapointed in the food ~ steaks and seafood. Sorry, maybe it was just an "off" night.
Music in dining room VERY loud! Energetic not how I would describe it. Told waiter and he just shrugged his shoulders. Very hard to have a conversation.

At the beginning of the meal, a waitress (not ours) brought out the wrong dishes to us to start. I had the Chicken Limone which was quite tender and flavorful except that the pasta and sauce was a bit dry as if it had been sitting under a warmer. My wife had the Penne San Remo, but was not quite as enthusiastic about it since it seemed to lack the flavor of the previous ones she had before. Over all a pleasant lunch. Bread was kind of soft and doughy, not like real italian bread.
Everything was great would totally recommend
Excellent food, great experience, unique place!

Despite the concerns that its menu was overly ambitious, its reach did not exceed its grasp! In other words, we were half expecting a failure due to the wide ranging menu, but,everything we ordered was not only quite good, but good in exciting and interesting ways! We had two of the Mediterranean trios, which means that we got to taste 6 different things - and here they were: African Tabouli - excellent Moroccan flavors; Persian salad - zippy fresh and complex; Pepper dolmates - delicious roasted peppers with a nice rice/pepper stuffing; paella - surprisingly nice shrimp, mussel and scallop flavor; Hummus - yum, Lentil soup - yum; and both dishes had a nice raita-like yogurt dish that just balanced everything. Our waitress was happy to chec

column4: 2845 Town Center Circle West Kingwood Town Center Kingwood, TX  77339
column13: This is one of the few restaurants which seems to improve over time. They don't have an extensive menu, but what they offer is prepared well, and tastes great! If they can improve upon anything, it would be the service consistency
Excellent food and service as always!

Cafe Ginger has consistently good food, a freindly staff, and very attentive servers. The decor is especailly intetesting and creative. It is a good place for people in the neighborhood, and also appropriate for a working lunch, as it has booths which allow for more private conversation. There is a large backroom suitable for parties.

Not much to look at, I'm assuming it looks "Bosnian," I've been to Croatia and it looked pretty close. The server was Bosnian and very helpful with the menu and recommendations. Food was very tasty, nice flavors and hearty. Really enjoyed the fried anchovie starter. The lamb shank was tender and services with a flavorful sauce and vegetables. One of the group have the goulosh, and raved about it
Food, presentation, and service were all excellent, and we have never had such delicious, perfectly prepared grilled asparagus! We will certainly return.

We were looking for someplace new to try since we come to Houston on business frequently, and Carmelo's did not disappoint. The exterior is very unassuming, and one might not even find it if you didn't know where to look. But the interior is beautiful with several dining rooms and even some for private parties. The food was delicious, and the portions were just the right size. The service was excellent with courteous and friendly waiters. Although they had a lovely and extensive dessert selection, we didn't want anything too heavy after our meal, so we opted for their house-made sorbets, and they were fabulous...tasted like fresh fruit just picked, and were the perfect finish to our dinner.

Nice atmosphere, nice music (not overwhelming so you could appreciate it), very pleasant place to attend with friends.The parking lot was crammed, which you can expect on a Saturday evening, but the table was ready on time, the reservation was properly managed and we could linger at the end of the dinner without feeling pushed out.One important thing: prima il dolce, e soltanto dopo il caffè !
We have been here several times and as always the food was excellent. The service is top notch. I wish I lived in the neighborhood so I could come here more often.
We have been dining here for 12 years. This is worth the drive from where ever you are in the Houston area.
I was excited about the menu items as well as the prices, but the quality of food was poor. We left half of our food on the plate and left there still hungry!
Food wasn't bad, but wasn't special either. Also took alot longer than we were expecting.
Everyone should experience Christopher's once, but beware because you will be leaving there planning your next visit!

The service was great. The only thing, they didn't have the chocolate tres leches cake that I so wanted to try this visit. It was okay though. The server offered other options to us so we went ahead and went for the regular tres leches cake.

Our evening was wonderful. Food excellent. My favorite waiter - EXCELLENT!! We had a great time and will definitely continue to visit this restaurant when we have a special occasion as well at for lunch time meals.

column4: 1520 Lake Pointe Parkway #500 Sugar Land, TX  77478
column13: We were celebrating my husband's 65th birthday during our last visit to Churrasco's.The great steaks just melt in your mouth. We were there at 2 PM and it was very quiet (which we like)and the service was very good............just like everytime we go there.It's one of our favorite places!

column4: 3202 Marina Bay Dr Ste M League City, TX  77565
column13: My wife and I enjoyed the food very much; even though I feel it was a bit pricy when compared to other restaurants in that area. The manager and one of the owners came by the table and made sure we were enjoying ourselves. The service started out good, but soon faded toward the end of our meal. The bar area is decorated very well. We really liked the granite counter tops. The bar stools are uncomfortable though, not enough padding. We were with another couple and we had to stand up several times to keep our rears from going to sleep. Also, the venue does not have very many foursome tables to view the band. In my opinion there are too many couples tables to handle a large crowd.
The food was different but very good. Our waitress Ansley was very knowledgeable and made the experience even better. I will definitely go back soon.
authentic cuisine, excellent service, attractive dining room- excellent restaurant.

column4: 5555 Washington Avenue Suite A Houston, TX  77007
column13: We went for my wife's birthday. While it is not quiet, it is quite fun and the food is awesome. Our server, Mary, was excellent and took very good care of us. We will definitely be back!
This was our first time to dine at Crapitto's... It was amazing! Wonderful service and Amazing food! We will definitely revisit!

column4: 2900 Travis Street Suite F Houston, TX  77006
column13: Really good sushi, I will be going back soon!
The steak and lobster dinner at was delicious. We had the tuna tartar appetizer and it was outstanding. Service was great. It wasn't crowded. We'll be back.
The service and food were outstanding. Plan on going back with friends.

column4: 5085 Westheimer Blvd., Suite 3125 In the Galleria next to the Westin Galleria Houston, TX  77056
column13: overall great experience, food was good service good. just a good experience

Excellent service and food here. Not one complaint to mention. The staff, including the manager, were all extremely friendly and helpful. The food was delicious, and the servings were healthy portions. Will make this one of my go-to places for a nice evening out. The downtown location was excellent, as we were able to go directly there after an event in the Theater District.

column1: Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House - Houston
column13: The staff was Amazing! So kind and treated us like royalty. We had a great time and the meal was off the charts. Will be back and have already been telling others about this place. Thanks for a special night.
Great consistent food. Great service. Good affordable wine list.
Excellent food, great waiters and nice ambiance. We took our mother there for her birthday. The waiter brought out a complimentary Bananas Foster, which was fabulous.

column4: 2800 Kirby Drive Suite A-100 Houston, TX  77098
column13: really really love this restaurant, great food!!!

Met some good friends on a Monday evening. The atmosphere was perfect for a quiet conversation. It was not crowded and there was no rush to get us to vacate our table. Our waiter was attentive, but not overbearing. The food was outstanding - not the typical Tex-Mex found around here. All in all, a great evening out!
Eric's is great place to dine before taking in a concert or play at the University of Houston.
Wonderful Sushi. The largest pieces of sashimi I have ever had. A wide variety of rolls and the fish was very fresh.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Houston
column13: It was all great. Our waiter was superber and the food was one of the best in town.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Houston Beltway
column4: 788 W. Sam Houston Pkwy North Houston, TX  77024
column13: We were seated reight away with no wait. Two waiters taking care of us. Food was very good. Very loud!!!

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - The Woodlands
column4: 1201 Lake Woodlands Drive, The Woodlands Mall Suite 305 The Woodlands, TX  77380
column13: This is our go-to place for special event dining, and Fleming's never disappoints! The food and service are impecable!
We love Frank's. The food is always fresh and the preparation is delicious, and not too complicated. Good ingredients and qulity produce and meat/fish/chicken make for a good meal!

column4: 1330 Wirt Rd Suite D Houston, TX  77055
column13: Great dependable neighborhood mainstay.

I first went to Gaidos in 1965 with my parents while on vacation in Galveston. And it was a great experience. We continue to go there to this day. You can not have a bad experience at Gaidos. The food is better than great and always fresh. The service is always impeccable. It is always our first dining choice in Galveston. And always will be.

column1: Gigi's Asian Bistro and Dumpling Bar
column13: It was a little dark when we first came in and then they turned up the lights so it was a little easier to see what was going on. The dumplings were very good.
Overall just an average experience but a little over priced. Incredibly loud dining room,merry brightly lit. Food was good but in Houston there are so many other better experiences to be found.

20 bucks for 6 shrimp! We've been here about 5 times, the first time was good, but the service has been horrible ever since. We will not be back at least not to dine. The bar area is pretty decent for a small town.
Good selection for lunch items (entree w/salad). The service was prompt and friendly. The food was delicious and you can earn Landry points, too. I would go again.
Ambience clearly caters to a different group than I would represent

column4: 1400 Research Forest Drive The Woodlands, TX  77381
column13: My Wife and I used to come for dinner at least once per week, this summer we travel overseas, upon our return we were looking forward to visit one of our favorite places to enjoy dinner, much to our surprise the place has change drastically, not only your restaurant layout but the menu is very different. Service was very poor we were very dissapointed with the overall experience.
Our server took special care of our group and took additional steps to accomodate us in regards to off the menu items.

Perhaps the best kept secret, this 10 seconds, in all of Houston. With a vibrant food scene going on in Houston, Hawthorne holds its own! While the menu is wonderfully fresh and innovative it has a degree of familiarity so as not to intimidate those who may not consider themselves "foodies". A quiet very romantic spot that is not to be missed.
It was our first visit and it was very good and very enjoyable. We will come back

Fabulous as always, although, the blackened scallops were a little fishy for my taste, the rest of the meal was fantastic! I ordered the carrot ginger soup for starters and it was to die for! I could have eaten two bowls, I wish I could re-create it at home. Also, the lobster ravioli that came with the scallops were delicious, wasn't crazy about the wasabi, but some people are, the Apple crumble for dessert was perfection and the adi rose was delightful, our server was too. :) This is our favorite date night pick for my husband and I and this time I brought a friend for her birthday, she fell in love with every bite! Than you Hubbell and Hudson for all of your foodilcious awsomeness! We'll be back for more!!!
Nice place. Will go back with a group.

Great dinner with some of the best service I've had in a restaurant in a long time. The only reason I gave 4 stars for the food is the lack of many healthier alternatives. Our entire party of 6 thoroughly enjoyed our meal.
Best restaurant I have ever been to and I have been to some great restaurants.

column1: J. McKinney's at the Hotel Fredonia
column13: Fabulous variety on the Sunday buffet!

Did not receive salads till main course after asking, due to Saturday night crowd.Small place, with small tables. Great for couples. Large groups would be squeezed.Excellant food, reasonable priced. Oxtail is fabulous, almost ordered another plate.

column4: 9595 Six Pines Dr #900 The Woodlands, TX  77380
column13: We were very lucky with our reservation on Saturday evening because we were given a table upstairs where it was much quieter. Downstairs it was extremely busy and noisy. Good for Jasper's but not what we enjoy! Last time we were there I order the rack of lamb and it was DELICIOUS. This time I order the peach pork tenderloin which was good but not as good as the lamb. My husband and our two guests thoroughly enjoyed their meal.I liked that the desserts, at least the cheesecake, was a smaller portion - just enough to satisfy the sweet tooth after a big meal.

For the food that was served the atmosphere didn't match it! The location they have would be great for their wine list and margaritas with their tapas. More of a fun bar restaurant instead of trying to be high end. Portions are very small and not a huge menu.

column4: 4500 Montrose Blvd Suite C Houston, TX  77006
column13: My wife and I have been Kam's fans for years. We recently returned and found the food and service better than ever. This is our favorite Chinese restaurant in Houston. Everything is fresh and prepared with care. Kam's has some really great and unusual specialty dishes. We particularly like their softshell crab dish.

column4: 3600 Kirby Drive Suite H Houston, TX  77098
column13: The food was amazing. Our server made some excellent suggestions. Ceviche was unique and excellent. The hamachi and jalepeno was a fantastic combination, very good. The rising sun roll was the best roll my wife and I have had. Finally, the Kobe beef skewers were amazingly tender and delicious. All around great meal. Highly recommended.
Too noisy, really unconfortable seats, average food quality....too expensive, not value for the money we paid.

As "Foodies" from SF Bay Area, we were blown away by the food at Killen's. Best crab cake ever (seriously), best steaks we've ever had (the dry-aged ribeye was perfectly cooked and flavorful), and the flavors just kept coming with great sides and creme brulee cake. Portions are HUGE - plan for a big doggy bag. Great attentive engaging service. Impressive and extensive wine list. A gem in a suburb of Houston
Everything was perfect...No complaints!

Visited this Location last year while at this same retreat and decided to dine there again. The food was ok although we had to send the steak back because it was barely cooked and we asked for medium. They took it back without any questions but it was still bleeding bright red when it was returned to our table. We decided they just couldn't get it right do we kept it. They were very busy so we assumed that was the problem. We have decided that next year we will go elsewhere....especially for the price. To pay $40 for a 7 oz steak and not get it cooked correctly after two tries is an issue. The wine was wonderful. The bread was cold. The side dish was ok. Two people with no appetizer =$150.. Too overpriced for just "ok" food

column4: 5061 Westheimer Road Houston Galleria Houston, TX  77056
column13: Our servor Parkson was great! He gave us awesome things to try; the berry mojito was amazing! It was my friends first time at the restaurant and eating sushi; she loved his recommendations!

This was our second visit, both times at lunch. Chef Kris is a great guy doing God's work! The food and service continue to amaze. The smoked short rib is merely one of the best dishes in the city/state/nation? A limited menu, but well balanced. Did I fail to mention the charcuterie? Kris offered a little taste of a lamb leg he had cured and hung. Sliced thin very like a serrano ham. Oh my, it was extraordinary!

Went for brunch. Not very much information out there about their brunch, except that it is good. It would be nice if they put information on their website. Apparently, they change the items as lunch time gets closer. I thought that this would be a "mexican food" buffet. It was normal breakfast items with a couple of omlet stations and a few mexican specialties. I probably will not go back or if I do, it will be later in the morning.

This is a wonderful place to hang out. But the food is not worth the price. Way to expensive for what you get. Appetizer and desert were great. The entrees - at a very hefty price - were bland. The filet was a poorly cut piece of meat with gristle! And it was served cool!

I always love this spot and every time I'm in Houston (visiting from Los Angeles), I try to have one meal there. The decor is fun, energetic yet classy. The basket of breads/pizza is fun to start with. I enjoyed the cucumber-basil gimlet -- the Perfect summer cocktail, followed by the Autum salad (yum!!), then the Crab Lump topped Snapper. The crab was excellent and well-portioned, but the snapper was just a touch overdone. Our server was Fantastic, along with all the rest of the staff. We were never rushed but always well attended to. The lights were a bit too bright where we sat and I felt a bit on display, but besides that unfortunate table selection, the ambiance is really quite fun and charming

column4: 3700 S. Texas Ave. , Ste 300 Bryan, TX  77802
column13: Outstanding!! 5 Star Restaurant!!Lovely atmosphere!! Always Excited and look forward to Dine in at La Riviera and enjoy the wonderful flavors of their food :) A Great Chef that takes time to come .say hello and make sure customers are happy.

column4: 23501 Cinco Ranch Blvd, Suite F140 Katy, TX  77494
column13: Loved the food. Just like Las Alamedas in Spring Branch that I went to all the time. Donya found a way for 8 of us to have a wonderful table at the last minute. That was very much appreciated.

Some of the food was outstanding (some items on the appetizer platter) and the salsa was different but good. The Pozole soup was not very interesting, it's better at other places. The premium margarita I had was good, but not a good bargain - small glass and mostly ice. The interior is pretty and the outside dining area looks really nice. Unlike a lot of Mexican restaurants in the area, they take reservations here so it is good for a work group. There is also a big parking lot, and parking can be a problem in this area so this is a nice feature. The downside: one member of our party had computers stolen from his car during the meal. More parking lot security would be a plus.

column4: 5709 Woodway Dr. Suite J Houston, TX  77057
column13: Surprisingly good! Our first ime here. I came expecting some kind of more-of –the same “latin” food and found a fantastic variety of ceviches and tiraditos along with the rest of the menu, of typical, well prepared and beautiful plates presented in an amazing contemporary way all in a modern set up. Amazing service that takes care of all the details. Thumbs up for Latin Bites.

Not sure what it's trying to be, a little casual for a fine steak house but a little fancy for a Cajun/Tex-Mex family casual. Odd combination of offerings, but interesting and well executed what we ordered.

Food was great. Real Texas comfort food. And the space is beautiful. But place was nearly empty at lunch. Wait staff didn't really seem ready at 11:50. Would absolutely recommend the place except for the ridiculous parking situation. YOu have to use hotel valet. Asked waiter if the restaurant validated; he said yes. Took our tickets and had them stamped. We got to the valet stand and valet told us the validation was only good for half the charge. Said we couldn't pay him; had to go back inside the hotel and pay at the front desk. Needless annoyance and waste of time.
Excellent food and service at Lomonte's, as usual. They kicked us out a bit abruptly when the restaurant closed, telling us that the bar was open late. Otherwise, a very pleasant dinner on the patio.

column4: 20 Waterway Ave., Ste 105 The Woodlands, TX  77380
column13: Went for a date and left with a smile. Had the the breadsticks are the perfect opener to any meal. We ordered the eggplant Parmesan and while not the greatest to look at the flavors were spot on. She had a salad (I was actually impressed with how fresh the ingredients were) and I had the Seabass, cooked perfectly, with mascarpone and corn risotto. I always try fish the first time at any place because its so easy to burn or undercook, L&L did not disappoint. We checked in via foursquare and were offered a free dessert so we tried the traditional Italian tiramisu. Everything including a 20% tip was $60. If price is an issue I could understand not coming here but if you want more than a correctly cooked meal then you will not leave unhappy.
Outstanding food and atmosphere. We will dine there again.

Awesome food...ate there on a Monday night and sat outside on the patio- perfect food and perfect wine (its BYO but they also sell wine). At the end of the meal the chef came out and talked about the food and his influences- overall a wonderful dinner.

column4: 3975 SH 6 South Suite 100 College Station, TX  77845
column13: Our food was good although I can remember it being better at other times there. I had salmon which was good although pasta was a bit dry. My husband had Pecan encrusted Chicken which was good. Our friends had the cannoli which she commented was not as good as the lasagna, but her husband had the chefs special which was excellent. Our waiter James seemed very nice and helpful, but did fail to keep water glasses full when reminded. The music was amazing with a man who played a guitar and harmonica. Great atmosphere. Thank you!

We celebrated our 10 year anniversary 10 years ago. We waited 10 years to go back for our 20th. We have decided to return every year from now on. This is by far the most elegant resturant in Houston and puts resturants in NY and LA resturants to shame. Houston best kept secret.

The best grilled red snapper I've had anywhere. My husband and I almost always order this and we are never disappointed. The crab and artichoke dip is a real winner, too. One of our favorite restaurants and one we take out of town visitors to often.
I enjoyed my time at Maggiano's. I would recommend this place to anyone.

The parking in the area is an Olympic challenge event. Yes there is valet available but they leave your car in the crackhouse district. The empanadas were greasier than just chugging a bottle of Crisco, the rest of the food was hit and miss. There are better tapas places in town so I would make an effort to come out here again.

As always, Mark's provided us with a memorable and special night out. They prepared an off-menu "surf & turf" that was fantastic. After initially waiting quite a bit of time for attention after we received our initial round of drinks, the waitstaff performed well and the tempo of the evening was acceptable. We love the ambiance, and it's packed every Friday and Saturday night so we hear, so the high prices don't seem to deter anyone - but it was not inexpensive - nearly $250 (1 appetizer, 2 soups, 2 entrees, 1 dessert, 4 drinks), before tip.

Food was good. Calamari appetizer is great. We had an OpenTable for 9 pm and we seated well after 9:30 pm. We had very little communication of when the table would be ready nor was there an effort to accomodate us in another way.

column4: 4720 Washington Avenue, Suite B Houston, TX  77007
column13: Best restaurant in Houston when you take into consideration their awesome tasting food, great service and their eclectic approach of menu items! They always have great pricing on multiple bottles of wines and their servers are very knowledgable and well versed n pairing wines with their food.
The food was very good, ambiance was also pleasent along with the wait staff.
Great classy spot for girls night out.

column4: 791 Town & Country Blvd. Suite 160 Houston, TX  77024
column13: The food and the service was wonderful. Our servier gave us several great ideas.We will be back
We had a few mishaps with our wine and food but the staff was very quick to change things and make it again. The scallops were the best scallops I've ever tasted!
Enjoyed the live, but background, music/singer on Saturday night. The food was delicious with a very good presentation. Visiting with the owners was a nice bonus.

Hadn't been back in a while due to a couple of underwhelming experiences. Tried again during Restaurant Week as a low-risk experiment to see if things had improved. They hadn't. Average food, average service. Lots of other restaurants in Houston in the style that this is trying to be that execute much better.
Good Italian food. Little bit of a wait to get entrees.

Service was undoubt horrible! This supposed to be a three star restaurant and it was anything but... I would have rather went to more inexpensive restaurant the meal cost $$$ but not worth it! Do not go expecting to have a luxuries experience because it will not happen.. The manager is smug and very rude. I love fine dining and go to all the four star restaurant in the area but this was defiantly the worst of the all.

This was the first time I have been to Morton's since the re-modeling took place. My family and I loved the former restaurant decor and ambiance. We didn't feel like we were in a Morton's with the new decor. Is this the new interior design for all the locations? I have thoroughly enjoyed Morton's locations in Singapore, both in Hong Kong, Baltimore, Pittsburgh, Cleveland, and Houston. If the new decor is a sign of the new ownership, I'm sorry to say we won't be back.Also, we missed the meat and vegetable cart that rolls up to your table during the order process, and the desert tray.

Yum Yum and then Some!! Thanks to Brad, Eric, Andy, and Javier! Our Anniversary was another memorable event indeed thanks to each and every personnel we have met, they made us feel like family, on every single visit. The food is spectacular, the ambien was energetic and classy, couldnt ask for more from our favorite restaurant!

column1: Mo's a Place for Steaks - Houston
column13: Overall a fantastic experience! I will be going there again.

column4: 4450 East Sam Houston Parkway South #A Pasadena, TX  77505
column13: Drinks were TERRIBLE! Ordered a Pina Colada (My FAVORITE drink) and drank maybe 4 sips... Waiter did not ask if he could fix or replace for me. Food was bland, this was supposed to be a date night for my husband and I. Now I know to go to Houston if I want great food. Do not waste your money here!!!
Great to see restaurant still in business. landmark in Houston.
Food was average at best. Wait staff ok. Typical Hotel Restaurant
Favorite place to eat in the entire Galleria.

This place is a little off the beaten path but not far. While the outside of the establishment is average the inside has a rustic charm and the dining area is nicely done. I has about 20 tables and wall racks w/wine all around. The staff could not have been nicer and the service was outstanding. We had the margherita pizza, thin crust, and it was hands down the best flavored thin crust pizza I have EVER had. Whatever is in the light sauce,totally sealed it for me. The meal $ are very reasonable (especially the pizza) and proportions just right.

column4: 5061 Westheimer Rd Suite 8050 Galleria Houston Houston, TX  77056
column13: I celebrated my Birthday and the waiter staff were excellent. Oceanaire bar staff gave me a Birthday card with all their signatures and a free glass of wine. The Seafood Mixed grill was excellent and very favorfully seasoned. To end the occasion, the waiter brought out a cake that was lit by applying rum and fire. My friends, son and I had a wonderful time. The valet parking is great and not expensive.

column4: 111 North Post Oak Lane Houston, TX  77024
column13: Fish was overcooked and dry. Not an interesting presentation. Service was not consistent, even though the restauratn was not busy. Furnishings at the Houstonian need a refresh.

Our table was just next to the musicians, we found it a little difficult to visit, while they were playing. We very much liked the music. Perhaps they could be in a far corner, not directly at the table. We had a wonderful evening and certaily will return.
The interior and exterior needs work - very tired looking and worn. It did not do the food or service justice. Both were very good.

The food, cocktails, wine and service were everything you would expect from the Palm - outstanding. I visited for lunch on this occasion and had one of their steak burgers which was cooked to perfection, prepared as described on the menu; very good indeed. I have visited the others: Fleming's, Morton's, Del Frisco, Smith and Wollensky but continue to be amazed at the consistency of the Palm Vs the others. I have been going to the Palm since 1991 and it is still a favorite. I do want to mention that the pricing is the best for the value and they have 1/2 price wine on Subday and Monday!

Everything was wonderful. The service, atmosphere, food were all great. I didn't like the smoked tuna. I could taste the tuna at all just the smoke flavor. But everything else was great. We celebrated our 30th anniversary and would love to go back for everyone from here on out.

column4: 110 Vintage Park Blvd. Suite P Houston, TX  77070
column13: The food and service here are great, its a nice date place.

Great place for a special occasion. The service was outstanding. I was a bit disappointed that the manager checked on the table next to us and never checked with our table, just as a courtesy. I felt as though she gives special attention to some and not others.

I had the pecan crusted red snapper - delicious; sauteed spinach and the whipped potatoes - yummy. It was preceded by the chopped salad (which I could not finish and decided to take home). My dinner mate had the salmon and found it more than satisfying. Unfortunately, we were so full, we had no room for dessert and that made me sad because they have so many wonderful options in that area.

column4: 23501 Cinco Ranch Blvd. Suite Q100 Katy, TX  77494
column13: We love the Friday luncheon pork chop special. It is always delicious and a special treat. We were celebrating two birthdays, and Perry's made our day special with a delicious dessert. Thank you, Perry's.

Salmon was fishy. Redfish was overdone and tasteless. Lyonnaise potatoes were not. Potatoes were properly browned, onion was barely cooked. Creamed spinach was so full of some herb that there was no spinach taste.
Always a pleasure dining at Perry's. Great food, great service and beautiful soothing music played at the piano.

column4: 2115 Town Square Place Sugar Land, TX  77479
column13: Best Steak and Pork chops!! Great Food nice atmosphere highly recommended.

My party of 9 received their food on time as well as the appitizers, however my order (NY Strip) was not cooked correctly and the cut was dry and firm (not even close to a prime cut for sure). They did take it off my bill however. Service on dessert offerings were slow and we had to chase down the waitress twice and actually used another for a time. Constanly asking for tea and coffee refills (should not be necessary) just fill it. 15-20% overpriced and would recommend other prime steak outlets if you are looking for a quality meal and dont mind paying for it leaving totally satisfied. I was not at Perry's. If you are charged $47.00 for a steak (especially in Texas) it better be good.

column4: 1800 Post Oak Blvd Suite 6110 Houston, TX  77056
column13: Food was good, not great, marred by an overworked waiter. Took 30 minutes for him to get around to taking our drink order -- and this from a restaurant where you expect to spend up to $100 a person for dinner! Two in our party ordered Champagne by the glass, and it was flat when it came out. They replaced it, of course, but still not acceptable.

We had to remind the waiter that we were short of time, but he speeded up once we did. I have the fish special - red snapper with lemon butter and capers - and it was delicious, as their fish specials always are.
Excellent food and service, as usual. When in this part of town, we typically choose to dine at Piatto Italian Restorante.
Our first experience with Peruvian fare. The staff including the owner were very helpful in guiding us.
Excellent place with great patio, awesome prices & delicious meals! Group of five friends visited this place & all left satisfied with service. Already made reservations for a return visit!

column4: 1415 S. Post Oak Ln. Houston, TX  77056
column13: Good business lunch location. Service is always fery good.

column4: 1550 Lake Pointe Parkway, Suite 500 Sugar Land, TX  77478
column13: Really enjoyed a business dinner that turned into a casual dinner. We went on a Tuesday night so it wasn't that crowded. Actually went to their bar adjacent to the restaurant which was really nice. Then went to dinner and had a most wonderful dinner with steaks cooked to perfection and a dessert to die for...chocolate cheesecake with creme' brulee topping.We ended up closing the place down...and they didn't rush us out. NICEYou will definitely enjoy a nice quiet dinner out.
Great food kinda expensive but cheaper than fogo
I had a dinner reservation for a Thursday night. Dinner was absolutely phenomenal. We didn't need to wait long for food and drinks, and the atmosphere was perfect.
I and my wife were both impressed with our experience at Quattro. The steak was amazing; the service top notch; the staff eccletic, fun and engaging. I would like to visit again, God willing.

Very pleased with the service, the decor was really interesting but it fit the restaurant so well. I ordered the lobster thermidor was really expecting something just mouth watering but it had a very sour taste to it forsure the oysters were the cause but the lobster was great, good place to take a date or family not to sure about kids.

column4: 16823 Theiss Mail Route Rd Houston, TX  77379
column13: We are returning customers, although it's been a while since our previous visits, we enjoyed our meal to the fullest. Raoul and his staff work very hard to ensure everyone has a great time at his place. "Don't judge a book by it's cover"as the setting outdoors is not too inviting, but make no mistake...this is a class A restaurant inside!

column1: Rattan Pan Asian Bistro and Wine Bar
column13: Lunch reservations were honored for eight. Server slow to take our food order. Drinks were replenished by server reaching across diners' faces to fill glasses. Appetizer platter & enrees were timely, delicious & beautifully presented. However, two of our party ordered a lunch special consisting of salad, entree & dessert. The salads and desserts never arrived. Had to flag a server to get the check. In short: food was excellent, service was poor & noise level was high.

What a wonderful dining experience. One of the best rib-eyes I have ever tasted, and I have tasted plenty of steaks. Our other entree was the duck and it was incredible. The staff is top notch. If there are only two dining ask for one of the three two top tables that have the kitchen view. Great interaction with the chef and his assistants. Make the drive to Fulshear, Ray's is worth the trip/
Great service and delicious food...

Found Reef online while looking for a great seafood restaurant during a weekend getaway to Houston. Everything was exceptional! We were so glad we chose it and if we make our way back to Houston again, we will certainly go back! Food is mouth watering and the service was friendly and so helpful.
The Remington has always been a favorite eatery for me. The wait staff is superb as is the presentation of the food. If you have a special dietary need, they will accomodate.

column4: Hilton Houston Westchase 9999 Westheimer Rd. Houston, TX  77042
column13: Very good steak, wonder service, decor is great. Had a good time!

column1: Ristorante Cavour at the Hotel Granduca
column13: From the moment we were seated, it was apparent we were getting service typical of a fine European restaurant--paced, deliberate, and yet very attentive.

My friend and I went for dinner on a Saturday night. It is a beautiful restaurant, so I had high hopes. First, we ordered a bottle of sparkling wine. It took about 15 minutes to get to the table. We did not ask for an explanation, but the waitress said that they were chilling it in the back. Needless to say, it was not cold. So she presented it in a plexiglass holder with no ice. I requested ice and our bottle disappeared for another 15 minutes. Oh well. On to the food (that is the reason we were there). The menu had many unique items and I was quite excited. We ordered an appetizer and two entrees. The entrees showed up before the appetizer, and the evening went downhill from there.

although nothing unique, the food was good, as was the wine... one minor complaint - it took awhile for the waiter to come to us after we had been seated, and we did not receive the food menus until after we received the wine

The Ruth's Chris Steakhouse ( Houston, Texas) location experience is one that I will not forget. I was celebrating my birthday there along with my wife and kiddos and Maria, our server, along with her assistant Garrison, made sure that our dining experience was extremely special! The food was brought out to us in a timely manner and each course was flawless in presentation and taste. I will always give these charming and professional people my patronage. The General Manager Jason Perkins is tops as well. Thank you guys for a wonderful birthday dinner experience!
I was not impressed with this place. Food was not average and they dont have good parking.

This was my 2nd visit to Saltwater Grill. The food is good, but a little odd, too. I had dish called barbeque redfish over grits. The barbecue sauce, while tastly and plentiful, overwhelmed the flavors of the fish and the grits. The salad was very nice, with very fresh ingredients and a nice dressing. The wait staff was excellent, but the noise level is quite excessive.

column4: 7900 N Sam Houston Pkwy W Houston, TX  77064-3425
column13: Nice location, right on the golf course. Food was good American food with plently of healthy options or burgers and fries if you want. I took my client here and was happy that it turned out well.

column4: 9595 Six Pines Drive Suite 1120 The Woodlands, TX  77380
column13: Being from Louisiana, I was a little skeptical about going to eat here. The food was excellent though. The chef's award winning crawfish dip appetizer was awesome....we shared one for the 4 of us and it was plently although we did have to ask for more bread for dipping. Our entrees were soooooo good. They had our table with a reserved sign on it and we were seated immediately upon walking in. Our waiter was just okay though....he got better toward the end of the meal. We'll definitely be going back!
Great food, service, and ambiance! Great 46th anniversary dinner!

column1: Shula's Steak House - Hyatt Regency Houston
column13: Are table was not ready upon arrival. For a high end steak house you should get better service. Everyone was moving in slow motion.

column4: Highland Village- 4007 Westheimer Rd Houston, TX  77027
column13: Our waiter was extra friendly, although it took a while to receive our menus. My date and I both ordered the filet mignon and lobster entree, side order of truffle mac & cheese, creamed spinach, and the creme brulee trio. Our waiter explained that all their cuts of steaks; except the filet mignon, go through a dry aging process and when cutting into the steak, there are no juices. We had our steak cooked medium well, my date's steak was on point but mine was dry and almost well done. The lobster is boiled with no seasoning, truffle mac & cheese is to die for, creamed spinach was creamed spinach, and the creme brulee trio flavors were vanilla, chocolate, and pumpkin. Vanilla was our favorite.

column4: 4820 Washington Ave Ste. A Houston, TX  77007
column13: Our first time dining there and it was better than expected. The ambiance was nothing like we've ever seen with lovely interior design. The food was phenomenal. Some dishes of note would be the Akasushi Short Ribs (starter) & the Rainbow Spider (specialty roll). For dessert, we had the Green Tea ice cream & the Creme Brulee, both were scrumptious.

Sorrel Urban Bistro has very good food but their menu should be reorganized. The portion sizes for a meal are on the small side. If they organized their menu into a first course and second course format, perhaps that would lead patrons to order appropriately. Currently, some of their entrees are priced and sized more like an appetizer portions. I believe that customers would be willing to pay a little more for a larger size entree portion. My feeling, however, is that they are trying to draw in a customer base that does not want to spend $$$ or $$$$ and therefore, the menu pricing and portion size are reduced. The quality of the food and service are very good. I hope that they will make some changes so that patrons don't leave hungry

Great, authentic Italian menu. Risotto appetizer prepared table side in a carved out block of Parmesan is a must. The service was excellent. The general manager and owner of the restaurant are always present and attentive.
We had to switch waiters half way thru dinner because the first waiter was so poor. However, our replacement was splendid!
Lives up to the t'afia reputation, but I think I like Sparrow better.

column4: Hilton Americas Houston 1600 Lamar St. Houston, TX  77010
column13: It was my birthday and I received a call from Spencer's to ask I'd I would like a private dining area which was very thoughtful. The service was fantastic, we had an appetizer, dinner and drinks served in less than an hour. The food was divine. We had the crab cakes, filet mignon, and the New York strip steak and the food was cooked to perfection. The atmosphere was quiet and romantic. We live in Houston, but plan to spend the night at the hotel and enjoy another lovely dinner real soon.

My girlfriend and I heard about Spindletop through friends so we thought we'd have dinner there to celebrate our anniversary. The ambiance was good, but too noisy for a special occasion. There was a table next to ours with a group of 4 and they were conversating as if they were at an outdoors setting! The food was excellent, though, and the view was nice. Overall, it was a good first experience.

column4: 800 W. Sam Houston Parkway Suite 940 Houston, TX  77024
column13: we sat outside and enjoyed the view of all the families and friends enjoying the park and live music. The food and service where great as well. Recommend.

column4: 122 Vintage Park Boulevard Suite A Houston, TX  77070
column13: An adequate find--service was excellent, but the food was mediocre.

Great food, deep south cuisine. We had their breakfast brunch buffet with all the usual foods but also included were several entrees that were not on the actual buffet: braised greens (wonderful), blackened salmon, Gouda cheese hash browns plus several other choices. Pianist plays and sings softly in the background. Thoroughly enjoyed our experience and will definitely return.

We had a wonderful experience. Joey was a very attentive waiter. Two managers came over to be sure things were going well. We were surprised to learn Del Friscos is a part of your company. We had a very unhappy experience there about a month ago. Sullivan's was a very nice contrast.
Raku is good Sushi for the downtown area. Hot rocks is a great appetizer....

Tabella is wonderful. The ambiance is great and the food even better. We have been for dinner and now lunch and both were superb . Tie restaurant is a new find for us inTje Clear Lake area and what a find! Elegant. Delicious, and a wonderfulPlace to eat with close friends. The staff is efficient and provides timeb for friends to visit and catch up. . I would recommend it to everyone whoWamts toBe well fed and visit with friends.

Very enjoyable, great ambiance and the food was excellent. The staff was professional and most efficient; handling our party of 4 with supurb service. The food and wine pairings were perfect. We will be back for sure and often.
The more folks you have in your party, the more tapas you can try. I will return. The meatballs are a must.

column4: 1660 W. Lake Houston Pkwy Ste. 105 Kingwood, TX  77345
column13: Great place to have a date. Nice view, and it's a good atmosphere. Definitely will be going back there in the future.

column4: 818 Town and Country Boulevard Suite 100 Houston, TX  77024
column13: Service as always was amazing!!! The live music Saturday night was excellent!!
The waiter gave us some really good margarita recommendations. He gave some great menu suggestions!

column1: Tintos Spanish Restaurant and Wine Bar
column4: 2015 W. Gray Suite J Houston, TX  77019
column13: It was our first trip to Tinto's. We will return!

column1: Tommy Bahama's Restaurant & Bar - The Woodlands
column4: 9595 Six Pines Drive, Suite 700 The Woodlands, TX  77380
column13: Our waiter, Austin, was really great. Perfect blend between helpful, funny, efficient and non intrusive for a group of ladies that were busy talking.
The service is always outstanding, but the prices are high and the entree portions are miniscule.
was an incredible experience, if you have not been, I highly recommend you experience the dining experience we were not rushed, food and service excellent belive me, we will be returning

column4: 201 West Bay Area Blvd Webster, TX  77598
column13: Waiter didn't seem to understand very well. Overall very receptive.
This was my first time dinning at Tradicao. The service was outstanding and the food was great.

This was an extordinary experience for us to treat our out of town guests My brother from L.A was very impressed with not only the food but especially the service. The food not only looked wonderful but turned out to be better than it looked. We were extremely grateful that even though we did not leave until after three pm, our server did not pressure us to leave even though we had stayed past their closing hours. She still was cheerfull and extremly confident of our every need.

column1: Truluck's Seafood, Steak and Crab House - Houston
column13: I've lived in Houston for 30 years and not sure how I missed this place. Really nice, nice ambiance, helpful and courteous staff. Not to mention the largest crab legs I've ever seen! Looking forward to going again.
The food was fabulous, the service out of this world. We will be back very soon!

Best dining experience of my life besides the other experiences at Uchi in Austin. I love the thoughtfulness of every dish and how it is presented to our table each time. I haven't had a waiter that isn't out of this world. Uchi is an addiction!

High quality ingredients; well executed,creative and flavorful dishes; small portions ("family style" dishes served two persons); not a value dining experience, but good for foodies who are willing to pay the price

column4: 9595 Six Pines Drive, Suite 860 Suite#860 The Woodlands, TX  77380
column13: Good environment, have two sections outside is more informal(close to the street), inside is more formal... food is OK for traditional Japanese dishes (I have tried better places) but it seems specialties are very good. I tried an Avocado Miso soup that was really good taste, the rest that we ordered were seafood salad and rolls, the rolls were ok but the salad was not seasoning enough.
All around excellent dining experience!

We had lunch on the patio. It was a beautiful day. We had a nice relaxing lunch. The food was great, the atmosphere was relaxing, and the waitstaff was the best. Michelle waited on our table. She was helpful with menu questions and service was right on the spot. She was not constantly interrupting our conversation but she was there when we needed her. The food came out hot, she was prompt with drink refills, and she cleared the table when we finished eating. She didn't rush us to finish by trying to take our plates while we were still eating. Too many restaurants try to rush you out the door. This restaurant is not like that. I will go back, enjoy the food, and spend time relaxing with family and friends.
We went for lunch and had an enjoyable time. The food and service were very good.

column4: 1131 Uptown Park Blvd, Ste 14 Houston, TX  77056
column13: One of the best Sushi's in Town

I always wanted to check this place out. So my honey and I made a date at Valentino, and we didn't know what to expect. I arrived first and they had great happy hour 1/2 off on drinks. So while I was waiting for my honey, the wait staff was very helpful in picking a drink. When my honey did arrive, we had the portabella mushroom it was so delish. He had the steak, and I had the eggplant parmasan. I was so stuff and the portion was more than enough. Great date night.
Had my mother's birthday dinner there with a small group. Had a quaint evening for her with wonderful food and atmosphere.

column4: 830 University Drive East, Suite 400 College Station, TX  77840
column13: Best filet I've had in a long time.

column4: 10700 Kuykendahl Rd. Suite F The Woodlands, TX  77381
column13: Usually, Via Emilia is consistently excellent... However they have become very busy lately and sometimes the quality of preparation isn't quite as consistent as in the past. This last visit, both my wife's and my Red Snapper was dry and overcooked. We are regulars at Via Emilia and trust this was an aberration and not a trend.
excellent evening. my request for a booth was honored. only complaint, we were surrounded by two large and boisterous groups, noise level was bothersome, not 'energtic' as your rating scale implies.

column1: Vida Loca Mexican Bar and Grill
column13: First time there...celebrating a birthday...it was a lot of fun and the food was very good.
Much better than its predecessor. We enjoyed the experience and will be back.
Grilled fish is delicious. Flounder and Red Snapper

Offered food for all types of eaters, not just sushi lovers, quality good, not over priced. Host served food, bartender served drinks. It was fine, except host dressed very casual and did not speak. Took away from a well done interior.
